The application opens a new page in a new window without cutting off the relevance with the original page. The page opened from that target link may have the access to the `location` object of the original page through `window.opener.location`. A malicious page associated with this link will be able to navigate the original page to an arbitrary site, such as a phishing site, and thus, execute a reverse tabnabbing attack.
